intro: Eugenia purpusii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Eugenia purpusii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
